Name: Texas Iced Tea
Ingredients: 10 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: SHAKE first 9 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. TOP with cola and serve with a stirrer.
Review: Packing six different spirits,  this Texas Tea is basically a Long Island Iced Tea with bourbon, and packs a suitably large Texan punch, especially if made with 6 x 15ml (½oz) measures of spirit as per the original recipe. If so choose a large (14oz) Collins to accommodate sufficient cola to achieve the desired dilution.
Nutrition: One serving of Texas Iced Tea contains 202 calories
